intro: Alluaudia, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. Alluaudia species are characterized by their succulent, branching stems and small, often clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The leaves are usually small and opposite, and the plants are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They play an important role in local ecosystems and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
